title: Park closed due to bear activity
text:
MORE If you were planning on visiting the Ramapo Mountain State Forest this weekend, you will have to rethink your plans.
The New Jersey Division of Fish and Wildlife closed all access points to the Ramapo Mountain State Forest earlier this week as a result of black bear activity and the park will remain closed until further notice. The division cited two separate encounters over the weekend
On Saturday, conservation officers and the state park service were notified of two different bear-human encounters at Ramapo. Three female hikers and a male hiker along with his dog reported being pursued by a bear but escaped unharmed.
The second encounter, which occurred later the same day, involved a bear following another male hiker on the parkâ€™s Yellow Trail. According to the hiker, the bear repeatedly approached and swatted at him. The hiker fought back with pepper spray but the bear continued its pursuit, before relenting near a pedestrian bridge.
Two weeks earlier a pair of hikers was closely followed by a potentially aggressive black bear at the forest, a 21-year-old woman and a 7-year-old boy. A third park visitor also came within close proximity of the same bear
The park was closed on Sunday and traps were set at that time and a portion of the forest was closed to hiking. Division personnel have also been keeping area police apprised of developments.
On Monday, captured and euthanized a bear that biologists believe was the bear involved in the encounters but,traps will remain in place and will be monitored by the division personnel.
For information on dealing with black bears visit: www.state.nj.us/dep/fgw/bearfacts.htm
